author: pdobacz
content:
The case of ERC-721 `safeTransfer` vs EIP-7702.

ERC-721 (similar for ERC-1155) standard tokens have a `safeTransfer` functionality, which provides a safe guard against sending tokens to an account which cannot interact with them. For recipients with code (`EXTCODESIZE != 0`) `safeTransfer` calls back to the recipient with `onERC721Received` and expects a certain magic value to be returned, otherwise reverts the transfer. Code size is checked because EOAs are assumed to always be able to interact with the token.

EIP-7702 introduces a case of recipients with EXTCODESIZE != 0, which do not respond to `onERC721Received`, but are valid because they are an EOA. Is this a concern?
